subject: Science

title: How Stars Die
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: How Stars Die.

hook.text: All stars die. How they die depends entirely on how massive they are.

buildup.text: Small stars like our Sun swell into red giants, shed their outer layers, and become white dwarfs.

discovery.text: A white dwarf is Earth-sized but as heavy as the Sun â€” a teaspoon weighs several tons.

twist.text: Massive stars die spectacularly â€” in a supernova explosion brighter than an entire galaxy.

climax.text: The heaviest stars collapse into neutron stars or black holes after the supernova.

punchline.text: Small stars fade quietly. Big stars explode. The universe rewards drama with drama.

quiz.question: What determines how a star dies?
